name: Vegan Stew - Classic & Hearty!
description: Classic, hearty and so cozy, this vegan stew is sure to warm you up on cold nights! It's thick and has plenty of chunky potatoes and vegetables, plus vegan "beef"!
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon better than bouillon vegetable paste*
1/2 cup red wine (may leave out if needed)
1 1/2 pounds potatoes, peeled and cubed (about 2 russets)
4 medium carrots, peeled and cut into 1 inch pieces
4  stalks celery, cut into 1 inch pieces
fresh chopped parsley, optional for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the warm water, better than bouillon paste and soy sauce in a large bowl. Add the soy curls and soak for 10 minutes until they are rehydrated. Drain, then add back to the bowl and toss with the garlic powder, pepper and flour.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the warm water, better than bouillon paste and soy sauce in a large bowl. Add the soy curls and soak for 10 minutes until they are rehydrated. Drain, then add back to the bowl and toss with the garlic powder, pepper and flour.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the soy curls, onion and garlic, and sauté for 3-4 minutes. Now add the wine and vegetable broth and stir, scraping off any browned bits from the bottom.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the soy curls, onion and garlic, and sauté for 3-4 minutes. Now add the wine and vegetable broth and stir, scraping off any browned bits from the bottom.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the potatoes, carrots, celery, tomato paste, rosemary and thyme. Reduce heat to medium/low heat and simmer for about 30 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the potatoes, carrots, celery, tomato paste, rosemary and thyme. Reduce heat to medium/low heat and simmer for about 30 minutes until the vegetables are tender.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch and water together to make a slurry. Slowly add the slurry to the pot, stirring, until you have reached a thick consistency. You may not need all of the slurry.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch and water together to make a slurry. Slowly add the slurry to the pot, stirring, until you have reached a thick consistency. You may not need all of the slurry.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the peas and simmer for about 5 minutes, then season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with chopped parsley and perhaps a side of crusty bread, biscuits or salad. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the peas and simmer for about 5 minutes, then season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with chopped parsley and perhaps a side of crusty bread, biscuits or salad. Enjoy!

keywords: beefless stew, vegan stew, vegetable stew
